item.title: Overgrown Tree Obstruction in Front of Business and local main footpath, 12th June
item.description:
Subject: Request to Address Overgrown Tree Obstruction in Front of Business – 74 Upper Street, Islington Dear Trees Team, My name is Shahid Islam, and I am the owner of Smoky Boys restaurant, located at 74 Upper Street, Islington, N1. I am writing to raise a concern regarding the tree located directly in front of our premises. The tree’s branches have become extremely overgrown and are now completely covering our shopfront signage, making it invisible to pedestrians and vehicles from both near and far. This is having a noticeable impact on our business by limiting visibility and reducing footfall. In addition, the tree’s placement and growth are beginning to interfere with access to the entrance, creating inconvenience for customers and passersby. I kindly request that the council assess the situation and arrange for the necessary trimming or pruning to address the obstruction, while of course preserving the health of the tree. Please let me know if any additional information or images are required. I would be happy to assist or meet on site if needed. Thank you for your time and support. Kind regards, Shahid Islam Owner – Smoky Boys Islington 74 Upper Street, Islington, N1 +44 7789 314936 Islington@smokyboys.com

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 202, Upper Street, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme Extreme wet wet dog fouling on the pavement which is near the kerb. Near the edge of the pavement., 12th June
item.description:
Extreme Extreme wet wet dog fouling on the pavement which is besides the kerb. People get in and out their cars besides this kerb. And children and adults cross the road besides this kerb. The fouling is near a tree which is in front of 95 Fernhead Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
